Contacts API documentation¶

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

REST API main¶

async main.cleanup_expired_tokens()¶
main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)¶
async main.rate_limit_handler(request: Request, ext: RateLimitExceeded)¶

REST API routes¶

async src.routes.v1.auth.login(form_data: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), request: Request = None, auth_service: AuthService = Depends(get_auth_service)) → TokenResponse¶

Authenticate user and return access and refresh tokens.

Args:

form_data: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm containing username and password. request: FastAPI Request object for getting client IP and user-agent. auth_service: Dependency-injected AuthService instance.

Returns:

TokenResponse: Contains access token, refresh token and token type.

async src.routes.v1.auth.logout(refresh_token: RefreshTokenRequest, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), auth_service: AuthService = Depends(get_auth_service))¶

Logout user by revoking access and refresh tokens.

Args:

refresh_token: RefreshTokenRequest containing the refresh token. token: Bearer access token from request headers. auth_service: Dependency-injected AuthService instance.

Returns:

None

async src.routes.v1.auth.refresh(refresh_token: RefreshTokenRequest, request: Request, auth_service: AuthService = Depends(get_auth_service)) → TokenResponse¶

Refresh authentication tokens.

Args:

refresh_token: RefreshTokenRequest containing the refresh token. request: FastAPI Request object for getting IP and user-agent info. auth_service: Dependency-injected AuthService instance.

Returns:

TokenResponse: New access and refresh tokens.

async src.routes.v1.auth.register(user_data: UserCreate, request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, auth_service: AuthService = Depends(get_auth_service))¶

Register a new user.

Args:

user_data: UserCreate object containing user registration details. request: FastAPI Request object to access request metadata. background_tasks: BackgroundTasks instance to handle sending email in background. auth_service: Dependency-injected AuthService instance.

Returns:

UserResponse: Registered user data.

async src.routes.v1.auth.request_reset_password(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, user_service: UserService = Depends(get_user_service))¶

Request password reset email.

Args:

body: RequestEmail containing the email address of the user. background_tasks: BackgroundTasks instance to handle sending email asynchronously. request: FastAPI Request object for building the reset URL. user_service: Dependency-injected UserService instance.

Returns:

dict: Message indicating whether the reset email was sent.

async src.routes.v1.auth.reset_password(token: str, body: ResetPasswordRequest, auth_service: AuthService = Depends(get_auth_service))¶

Reset user password using the reset token.

Args:

token: Reset password token provided in email. body: ResetPasswordRequest containing the new password. auth_service: Dependency-injected AuthService instance.

Returns:

dict: Confirmation message after password is successfully changed.

async src.routes.v1.contacts.create_contact(body: BaseContact, contacts_service: ContactsService = Depends(get_contacts_service), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.v1.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, contacts_service: ContactsService = Depends(get_contacts_service), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.v1.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, contacts_service: ContactsService = Depends(get_contacts_service), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.v1.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), contacts_service: ContactsService = Depends(get_contacts_service), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.v1.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(days: int = Query(7), contacts_service: ContactsService = Depends(get_contacts_service), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.v1.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), contacts_service: ContactsService = Depends(get_contacts_service), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.v1.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: UpdateContact, contacts_service: ContactsService = Depends(get_contacts_service), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.v1.users.confirmed_email(token: str, user_service: UserService = Depends(get_user_service))¶
async src.routes.v1.users.me(request: Request, token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), auth_service: AuthService = Depends(get_auth_service))¶
async src.routes.v1.users.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, user_service: UserService = Depends(get_user_service))¶
async src.routes.v1.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), user_service: UserService = Depends(get_user_service), admin=Depends(get_current_admin_user))¶

REST API config¶

class src.conf.config.Settings(_case_sensitive: bool | None = None, _nested_model_default_partial_update: bool | None = None, _env_prefix: str | None = None, _env_file: DotenvType | None = WindowsPath('.'), _env_file_encoding: str | None = None, _env_ignore_empty: bool | None = None, _env_nested_delimiter: str | None = None, _env_nested_max_split: int | None = None, _env_parse_none_str: str | None = None, _env_parse_enums: bool | None = None, _cli_prog_name: str | None = None, _cli_parse_args: bool | list[str] | tuple[str, ...] | None = None, _cli_settings_source: CliSettingsSource[Any] | None = None, _cli_parse_none_str: str | None = None, _cli_hide_none_type: bool | None = None, _cli_avoid_json: bool | None = None, _cli_enforce_required: bool | None = None, _cli_use_class_docs_for_groups: bool | None = None, _cli_exit_on_error: bool | None = None, _cli_prefix: str | None = None, _cli_flag_prefix_char: str | None = None, _cli_implicit_flags: bool | None = None, _cli_ignore_unknown_args: bool | None = None, _cli_kebab_case: bool | None = None, _secrets_dir: PathType | None = None, *, POSTGRES_DB: str, POSTGRES_USER: str, POSTGRES_PASSWORD: str, POSTGRES_HOST: str, POSTGRES_PORT: int, DB_URL: str = '', REDIS_URL: str = '', ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_MINUTES: int, REFRESH_TOKEN_EXPIRE_DAYS: int, ALGORITHM: str, SECRET_KEY: str, MAIL_USERNAME: str, MAIL_PASSWORD: str, MAIL_FROM: str, MAIL_PORT: int, MAIL_SERVER: str, MAIL_FROM_NAME: str = 'Contacts API', MAIL_STARTTLS: bool = False, MAIL_SSL_TLS: bool = True, USE_CREDENTIALS: bool = True, VALIDATE_CERTS: bool = True, CLD_NAME: str, CLD_API_KEY: int, CLD_API_SECRET: str, CLD_URL: str)¶

async src.utils.healthchecker.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Perform a health check for the API.

  • Verifies if the API is up and running.

  • Tests the database connection with a SELECT 1 query.

  • Returns a success message or an error if the database connection fails.

src.utils.reset_password_token.create_reset_password_token(data: dict) → str¶
src.utils.reset_password_token.get_email_from_reset_password_token(token: str) → str¶

REST API services¶

class src.services.auth.AuthService(db: AsyncSession)¶

Bases: object

async authenticate(username: str, password: str) → User¶

Authenticates a user with a username and password.

Args:

username: The user’s username. password: The user’s plain-text password.

Returns:

The authenticated User object.

Raises:

HTTPException: If authentication fails.

async change_password(email: str, new_password: str)¶

Changes the password of a user.

Args:

email: The email of the user whose password is to be changed. new_password: The new password in plain-text.

Returns:

None

Raises:

HTTPException: If the user is not found.

async create_acces_token(username: str) → str¶

Creates an access token for a user.

Args:

username: The username of the user.

Returns:

A JWT access token as a string.

async create_refresh_token(user_id: int, ip_address: str | None, user_agent: str | None) → str¶

Creates and stores a refresh token for a user.

Args:

user_id: The ID of the user. ip_address: The user’s IP address. user_agent: The user agent of the client’s request.

Returns:

A plain refresh token string.

decode_and_validate_access_token(token: str) → dict¶

Decodes and validates a JWT access token.

Args:

token: The JWT access token.

Returns:

The decoded payload.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the token is invalid.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer)) → User¶

Retrieves the current authenticated user based on access token.

Args:

token: JWT access token (automatically provided by FastAPI dependency).

Returns:

The corresponding User object.

Raises:

HTTPException: If the token is invalid, revoked, or user not found.

hash_token(token: str)¶

Hashes a token using SHA3-256 algorithm.

Args:

token: The token to hash.

Returns:

The hashed token as a hex string.

async register_user(user_data: UserCreate) → User¶

Registers a new user in the system.

Args:

user_data: Data required to create a new user (username, email, password).

Returns:

The newly created User object.

Raises:

HTTPException: If username or email is already taken.

async revoke_access_token(token: str) → None¶

Revokes an access token by adding it to a blacklist in Redis.

Args:

token: The JWT access token.

Returns:

None

async revoke_refresh_token(token: str) → None¶

Revokes a refresh token.

Args:

token: The plain-text refresh token.

Returns:

None

async validate_refresh_token(token: str) → User¶

Validates a refresh token and retrieves the associated user.

Args:

token: The plain-text refresh token.

Returns:

The associated User object.

Raises:

HTTPException: If token is invalid or user not found.

async validate_reset_password_token(token: str) → User¶

Validates a reset password token and retrieves the user.

Args:

token: The reset password token.

Returns:

The associated User object.

Raises:

HTTPException: If token is invalid or user not found.
